page.para: This is Rita, my pet cat. She never wants to play with me.
“Come here, Rita!” I call. But she just runs away from me. Rita does whatever she likes.
When I want to stroke her, Rita hides. Sometimes I think she doesn’t want to be my friend.
“Don’t go outside, Rita,” I say. And there she goes. I must follow her.
She pulls a sock from the clothes line. Dad will be cross when he sees what she’s done to it.
And who is she pestering now, in the dirt?
Now she’s ruffled some feathers! “Stay away, Rita!”
“You will need a wash before you can come back inside.”
Too late! But where is she now? She’s not in her basket!
“Oh, Rita!” What a mess she’s made in my bedroom. I’ll have to clean it up.
